channel.title: Good Paid-For Advertising?
channel.description: The title says it all, we've gained around a hundred dollars or so and after VPS expenses we still have some left over to get some advertising on RSPS sites. The only problem is that I have never worked with any paid for sites and I'm wondering what the best ones are? Thanks

item.title: Good Paid-For Advertising?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Tom:

I’d like to apologize on behalf of Ruby, he’s just admitted he has no idea what he’s talking about and that his advice was fabricated because he thought it was funny. As he’s now rightly corrected himself I’d like to reaffirm his position and say that every other status page is inferior to this one in every respect, and that you should all bid for sponsored server.

HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH

Tom lies. He lies a lot. He’s just upset because niggerliki has a better toplist.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Paid-For Advertising?
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Yeah it was our original goal to bid for Mopar sponsor. We’ll follow through with that now that I’ve gotten the opinion of the public along with some other ideas. Appreciate it guys, and post anymore suggestions if you have them.

@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

It would seem I don’t have freedom of speech and now have to put up with a crying Tom (a very vicious monster at the best of times) so please take this new advice AND BUY EVERYTHING YOU CAN ON THE MOPAR SSP.

item.title: Good Paid-For Advertising?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Ruby:

I really wouldn’t Don’t buy a moparscape sponsored server, go for google if you can get it since it has the most traffic from what I remember. No offence to MoparScape or MITB but the status page isn’t the best place to stick your server on as a sponsor, it doesn’t really get enough traffic to make that big a difference if it’s the only place you’re sticking an advertisement on.

inb4 ban

Read full topic

item.title: Good Paid-For Advertising?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I really wouldn’t buy a moparscape sponsored server, go for RL if you can get it since it has the most traffic from what I remember. No offence to MoparScape or MITB but the status page isn’t the best place to stick your server on as a sponsor, it doesn’t really get enough traffic to make that big a difference if it’s the only place you’re sticking an advertisement on. Other han that, cane’s post is pretty accurate. It’s a given that you should have your website developer read up on SEO techniques (even at beginner level) to improve your SEO ranking and ultimately give you a better return from search engines.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Paid-For Advertising?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

Purchase social bookmarks, high quality private network backlinks and social backlinks. Then optimize for medium-low competitive search terms and keep your website updated with new content once or twice and within a month you will see high rankings.

Some gigs on fiverr can help you with social bookmarks and backlinks.

Read full topic

Only one option, buy Google.
